text: Elvin Ray Jones (September 9, 1927 â€“ May 18, 2004) was an American jazz drummer of the post-bop era. From 1960 to 1966, he was a member of the John Coltrane quartet. His brothers Hank Jones and Thad Jones were also jazz musicians with whom he recorded. He was added into the Modern Drummer Hall of Fame in 1995. ==References== Category:1927 births Category:2004 deaths Category:Deaths from heart failure Category:American jazz musicians Category:American drummers Category:Musicians from Michigan Category:People from Pontiac, Michigan
title: Elvin Jones
